include virtual starttake hideshow httpuseragentshow  gather to take back the night hideshow httpuseragentshow CAMPUS Men women brave rain wind to rally for rape awareness hideshow httpuseragentshow photo start Petter GoldstineThe Daily The Committee Organization for Rape Education displayed silhouettes representing victims of domestic violence on the HUB lawn this week to promote awareness PERIOD photo end Megan Aemmer hideshow httpuseragentshow UW News Lab hideshow httpuseragentshow

A group of about  men and women gathered on the HUB lawn last night in blustery weather to hear speakers  scheduled and otherwise  speak out against sexual assault and relationship violence at the  rally PERIOD The final event in the ASUW Sexual Assault and Relationship Violence Week included featured speakers UW Police Chief Vicky Peltzer and spokenword artist Tara Hardy PERIOD

Peltzer offered several suggestions for avoiding assault such as using UWCARES walking with friends and carrying a whistle PERIOD Mentioning the two rapes reported at the UW last year one of which was alcoholrelated Peltzer urged students to take control of the problem of sexual assault PERIOD

 she said PERIOD 

Discussing the UWPDs commitment to confidentiality and sensitivity regarding rape and sexual assault cases she added that the statement can be found on the UWPD Web page PERIOD

The annual Speak Out session followed during which several UW students shared stories thoughts and poems about sexual assault PERIOD

Sean a man whose girlfriend is a survivor of sexual assault reminded survivors that their partners are also victims of violence PERIOD He urged them to be aware that although they will go through pain and hard times  for their partners too PERIOD

An anonymous UW student told of her sexual abuse by her father and gave advice for those who have friends or family who have been sexually abused or assaulted PERIOD  she said PERIOD

Two attendees stressed the importance of the rally as a way to provide support for survivors and educate others PERIOD

 said junior women studies and sociology major Carly Lindberg PERIOD

 added sophomore anthropology major Jen Daly PERIOD hideshow httpuseragentshow Previous article Next article Copyright2000 The Daily University of Washington include virtual
